title: Donate to Support the Gaudio Family
description:
Dear Friends,

Our names are Amy Colcher and Booda Sanchez. Bernadette Gaudio is our best friend. Her children, Robert and Andrew, are like our children. The Gaudio family has been the victim of an unfathomable and heinous crime. On Sunday, December 8, 2024 - during a home invasion Bernadette was shot multiple times and paralyzed, and Andrew was murdered. A young man of 25 whose life was just beginning - gone. A mother, who lost her husband 15 years ago is now facing the loss of her youngest son and a life of possible paralysis. Robert, a young man who lost his father as a child is now faced with the loss of his little brother and the medical care of his mother.This family has faced too many tragedies.
 
 Robert, is standing strong - but he needs our help. This is a call to the community - PLEASE GIVE WHAT YOU CAN! No amount is too small. Funeral costs, medical costs, and costs of life long care for Bernadette are daunting.

title: Support Johnny's Fight Against Brain Cancer
description:
Over the next two months – and possibly longer – Johnny will be receiving daily radiation and an aggressive round of chemotherapy. At this point surgery to remove the tumor is not an option as it is too close to his cerebellum. Both Molly and Johnny will need to be at the Mayo Clinic throughout this treatment. His parents, brother, and other family members will be helping as well, as they have been through this whole ordeal. On top of what will surely be a grueling treatment, both Molly and Johnny’s lives will need to conform to living in Rochester. This financial goal aligns with the immediate expenses Johnny and Molly will face in coming months, including increased COBRA insurance payments, living expenses in Rochester, and lost wages. Our goal is to lighten at least the financial burden this crisis presents. As anyone who knows them well understands, asking for this kind of help is uncomfortable for them, which is why we're doing so on their behalf. They are so grateful for your support. We will keep this community updated on their needs as we learn more. For now, please donate what you can and encourage others to do the same.

To know Johnny is to love him. Everyone who crosses paths with him knows him to be one of the kindest and sweetest guys around. His gentle nature and beautiful spirit radiate from within. He is now battling the scariest battle of his life, and it is time for those who love him to try to support him and his wife, Molly, as best we can.

title: Support Karissa's Battle Against Terminal Stage 4 Cancer
description:
Dear Friends, Family, and Supporters,

It has taken me a long time to find the courage to write this letter. Sharing something so deeply personal is not easy, but today, I am opening my heart to you because I believe in the power of faith, community, and love. I also believe that sharing my story will bring more people into our circle of prayer, support, and hope during this challenging time.

 In January 2022, after 17 years of remission, I received devastating news: my breast cancer had returned. This time, however, it came with the diagnosis of stage 4, terminal cancer. The shock was overwhelming—after so many years, I never imagined I would be here again. Even now, writing this brings a flood of emotions. But my love for my family—my incredible husband, my amazing children, and my supportive friends—gives me strength every single day. They are my world, and I want to be here for them as long as possible.

 For nearly three years, I have been undergoing treatments at some of the best medical facilities in the U.S., including MD Anderson, Dana-Farber, and City of Hope. While these treatments have helped, my options are becoming limited. Some promising procedures and medications that could extend my life have yet to be FDA-approved in the United States but are available overseas. After extensive research, my family and I have identified a highly reputable facility abroad offering treatments that give us hope for more time together.

 Unfortunately, these treatments are not covered by insurance. Every test, every hospital stay, every procedure—right down to the blood work and anesthesia—comes with significant out-of-pocket costs. These expenses are beyond what my family can manage alone, which is why I am humbly asking for your help.

title: Tokens for Tinley
description:
On November 19th, Tinley developed a respiratory illness and later came down with an ear infection and was given antibiotics. During the next two weeks, Tinley fought hard to fight it off, but on Friday, November 29th, Tinley became unresponsive. She was taken to Children's Mercy that evening and was unresponsive for the next 29 hours. They diagnosed Tinley with meningitis and encephalitis from Mycoplasma pneumoniae (community spread pneumonia). Tinley is making a great comeback and is currently in rehab at Childrens Mercy in Kansas City.

 Tinley is an 8th grader at Holton Middle School in Holton, Kansas.

title: Support San Miguel Students' Bright Future
description: Our Story: San Miguel School is an all-boys Lasallian middle school which consists of 64 kids (16 per grade). At San Miguel, they take students from troubled backgrounds in the Providence area and provide them with a safe and caring environment. At the end of their time at San Miguel, students are provided counseling through the process of getting into high school and then college, a service they normally would not have. San Miguel is run totally off of donations. These donations go towards breakfast and lunch for the students, classes, after-school programs, uniforms, and financial literacy courses. After visiting the school and getting to talk with some of the faculty and students, we all knew that San Miguel was the organization that we wanted to work with. Out of all the people we met when we visited, there wasn’t a single person who met us with anything but kindness and respect. Looking around, you could really see that the students enjoyed going to school there and that the faculty really enjoy working there. After observing all of these things, it has motivated us to raise as much money as possible so that these kids and the future San Miguel students can continue to enjoy learning and making friends in such a great environment. With your money, we will be able to sponsor a San Miguel student and provide him with the support he needs to get a great education in a safe and caring environment.

title: Help Ahmed Restore His Dreams and Family
description:
Ahmed's story as passed through and translated through Seigen Mizu Dojo:

 Hello, I am Ahmed, 20 years old, studying computer engineering. I had big dreams and ambitions, but because of the war, I lost everything I was exposed to many dangers

 Last January, the occupation ordered us to evacuate our house, and I am the sole breadwinner for my family. We were displaced on foot for a long distance under the showers of bullets and rain. From that day until today, I have been homeless, without shelter, and without work. Our house was demolished, I lost my car, and my university was bombed by the occupation, so I want to complete my studies and education and build my dreams again

title: Brighten the Holidays for SF Youth
description:
Support Independence High School youth this holiday season! Consider donating here to purchase gift cards for our homeless/unhoused and foster youth families this holiday season.

 Donations of $25 or more are eligible to receive a limited edition SF BIRDS 2025 calendar and accompanying Owls of San Francisco mini-calendar featuring photographs of San Francisco's most photogenic birds by IHS principal Anna Klafter. Reach out to the IHS office to redeem your calendar. Only 100 copies available!

Thank you for your generosity!

title: Help C.S. Porter Middle School get a new kiln.
description:
You know me as Candice. My students know me as Ms. H, Ms. Haster, or Ms. Candice. I'm a ceramic artist and I teach art in Missoula, Montana - currently at C.S. Porter Middle School. Our kiln is in dire need of replacement, and I'm here to ask for your help. As you know, district budget cuts have impacted the arts in heartbreaking ways. Our kiln is the oldest in the district, and deemed the most in-need of replacement. It is inefficient (heating consumes an estimated 5x the energy of a new kiln) and it misfires consistently, resulting in damage to student artwork, funky glazes, lots of wasted time and energy, and broken hearts. You all remember how heartache felt in middle school, right? I'd like to prevent that, where I can, and give these kids a chance to feel proud, accomplished and to celebrate their creativity and creative risk-taking.

 C.S. Porter is the only Title 1 Middle School in Missoula. That means that the youth we serve are largely low income. This also means that your donation will be 100% tax deductible.

title: Help Mindy and Andrew Rebuild Their Bridge
description: As many of you know, on September 28th tropical storm Helene changed our beloved home of Western North Carolina forever. Mindy and Andrew’s home was no exception. While their house was left undamaged, the bridge to their house was washed away by Reems Creek. What was once a 25 foot span bridge will need to be replaced by a 65 foot span bridge due to widening of the river bed. FEMA has given them some funds toward rebuilding their bridge, but far short of the cost of building. Please consider supporting my dear friends and neighbors in their recovery effort

title: Help us buy trees!
description:
Greenwich Eco Alliance is an upcoming non-profit founded by Greenwich High School students looking to make Greenwich a greener, healthier, and more beautiful place to live.

Your donations will go to purchasing trees and plants and planting them throughout our community.

Help us by donating to enhance the environment YOU live in and providing numerous benefits for the generations to come!

title: Help White Marsh Families Fight Pollution
description: The White Marsh Cowenton Improvement Association is advocating on behalf of our residents who are passionately opposed to construction of a crematory which will operate daily within their neighborhood. White Marsh is a community of growing families, retired households, elderly and disabled who have joined together in opposition to a proposed crematory as close as 250 ft from someone's residence. The crematory operator has deep pockets and we need your help to protect our community from additional pollution in White Marsh.

title: Join Us Give Relief Efforts After the Hurricane
description:
Help people affected by Hurricane. Your donation enables the Red cross to prepare for, respond to and help people recover from this disaster.

 Hurricane made landfall in some parts of the country and continues to devastate the Southeast, claiming lives of numbers of people and destroying homes and businesses of countless families.

Let's come together to help the hurricane victims.

Thank you for your generosity.

title: Help Elias's Family During This Crisis
description:
On December 4, 2024, our five-year-old grandson, Elias, was shot in a school shooting at Feather River Adventist School, the small Christian school he attends in Northern California. The bullet went through his chest and abdomen, piercing and nicking multiple organs before exiting. He was airlifted to the hospital, where he underwent emergency surgery to stop the bleeding. He is currently sedated and on a ventilator in PICU, awaiting additional surgery. Though in critical condition, he is stable at the moment.

We are overwhelmed by the great outpouring of love, concern and especially prayers. You cannot know how much it means that there are hundreds, if not thousands, lifting Elias up before our Heavenly Father. Thank you.

 We have also had people reaching out asking how they can help. In answer to these requests, we have set up this fund to help the family through this difficult time. Your support means so much.

title: Bohm Family: Rebuilding After Tragic Fire
description: We are raising funds for the Bohm family who lost everything today on 12/12 due to a house fire. The family lost all belongings, vehicle, and everything they owned. They have NOTHING and need everything! All donations will be 100% donated for the family to buy necessities. They have 3 amazing boys and a beautiful baby girl that is on the way. Please share this with everyone you can and let’s come together for the Bohm family!

title: Help Rohan Recover From His Brain Injury
description: This go fund me is for Rohan Shukla and his family so we can help them in any way possible as he recovers from his injury. He sustained a brain injury during our Thanksgiving football game and is currently in the hospital after having brain surgery.

title: From Hospital to Homeless: Christina's Story
description:
My name is Christina Sivilay. I recently had a stroke and I was in a coma for a while, but I don't remember how long. When I woke up, I saw my family and friends. I was unable to speak, and I couldn't remember their names. I wanted to say words to them, but due to the rupture and swelling in my brain, I couldn’t process the words to say. I was in the hospital for 2 months recovering. I was doing PT OT and speech therapy to get better. When I came home, my entire life had changed. My mom, my aunt and everyone that was close to me try to help me to get better and supported me however they could. I am not fully recovered and my whole right side I can barely move it. I wish I was back to how I was before, but I can't. I struggle doing the smallest tasks, and feel stuck - unable to freely do the things I use to. Everyday I want to cry because of how this stroke has paralyzed my right side preventing me to do things with my kids. It's hard for me to sleep and eat.

Soon after, I found out that I'm getting evicted from my own home with my two kids. Unable to work or receive financial help. I now have 2 months to find a place to stay with my two kids. I have nowhere to go except for the shelter or the streets. It would mean so much to me if any of you can help.

Any donation will help; it doesn't have to be much. I just want a warm safe place for me and my kids this Holiday and Winte

title: Support Western NC Families Impacted by Hurricane Helene
description:
My name is Bill St. Pierre, owner of St. Pierre Woodworking (Floyd, VA). I am raising money for families in Western NC who were impacted by Hurricane Helene.

I am looking to help support multiple families that I connected with over social media (and through prior relief efforts since the storm) and then met in person to see their needs. Excess funds may be used to support additional families or organizations that are identified that need help or are supporting disaster relief efforts.

Funds may be used as follows (to include but may not be limited to): disaster cleanup (debris removal, site cleanup), home rebuilding (materials, labor costs), shelter (hotel expenses, temporary shelter purchases/campers), heat (heat pumps, furnaces, small heaters), or food/water. As I travel to the impacted area to support, I may also use a small amount of the funds for fuel/transportation costs, equipment service/maintenance, meals, or lodging.

title: Support the Santoro Family After Fire Tragedy
description:
Help the Santoro’s Rebuild After Devastating Fire

Dear Friends, Family, and Community,

We are reaching out with heavy hearts to share the news of a devastating fire that struck the home of Tallman Fire District Commissioner John Santoro, his wife Christine, Chief James Santoro, and Lieutenant Charles Schmidt of the Tallman Fire Department on December 14th. This unexpected tragedy has left the families not only without a home for the holidays but also without many of their personal belongings.

As dedicated members of the Tallman Fire District and Department, John, James, and Charles have spent countless years serving and protecting our community. They have been there for us during our times of need, and now it's our turn to support them during theirs. Their commitment to public service and safety has been unwavering, and we are determined to help them rebuild their lives after this unfortunate event.

title: Please help our family after a devastating house fire.
description:
My sister and my two nieces lost everything today 12/13/24 due to an electrical fire in their home. They were not home at the time but did lose their cats and dog in the fire. The house is a total loss along with everything in it. Barbie, Mia and Layla will need to start over. Please help in any way you can. Donations of furniture, toiletries, clothing etc are needed as well. Please pray for them as they go through this devastating loss right before the Holiday's.

The family is in need of women's adult clothes size small or medium. Womens shoes size 6 and 8. Girls clothing size 7/8-9/10 and shoe size kids 1. Toys, household items, toiletries etc are all needed. You can drop off donations to 4537 N Green Bay Rd in Racine Wisconsin anytime after this Sunday 12/15/24. We will appreciate anything and everything! Thank you so much everyone. We truly appreciate all of the help!

title: Urgent Relief for our Family in Gaza
description: On October 7, 2023, our lives were shattered by the conflict that struck Gaza. Our home—once filled with laughter, love, and memories—was reduced to rubble. In an instant, everything we had worked so hard for was gone. We lost not only our home but also our source of livelihood and any sense of stability. Now, we are left with nothing but the clothes on our backs and a deep longing for peace and safety.
